STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 16, 2021
Brian Millikin
Midland/Gladwin County DHHS
1509 Washington Ste A
Midland, MI 48641
RE: License #: CP560201302
Midland/Gladwin County DHHS
1509 Washington Ste A
Midland, MI 48641
Dear Mr. Millikin:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on (date). Due
to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been
given an application for renewal of the license not less than
60 calendar days before the expiration date of the license.
One of the eight current foster home files reviewed indicated the foster parents were
not given an application for renewal of their foster home license at least 60 calendar
days before the expiration date of the license. In this instance the expiration date of
the license was 7/06/2021 and the application was sent 6/03/21.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications shall include all
of the following:
(a) Age,
(b) Gender,
(c) Race,
(d) Number of children preferred by the family,
(e) Characteristics of children best served by the home,
(f) Children who may not be placed in the home. The
child's racial, ethnic, and cultural identity, heritage, and
background may only be considered if an assessment of
the individual child indicates that such consideration is in
the best interests of the child.
Four of the eight current foster home files reviewed contained annual evaluations of
the foster home that did not maintain compliance with this rule. The first instance
made a statement there should be no change, without presenting what the current
characteristics were approved. Four of the eight files had an age range that was
inconsistent with the applicable license (3706). This is a repeat noncompliance
from the renewal evaluation completed 05/08/2020.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(e) A list of all children currently placed in the home.
3

One of the three borrowed home files reviewed did not include a placement list of
children placed in the home. At the time of the exit conference, it was reported the
home had not had any previous placements until the borrowed bed placement was
made.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(h) A copy of the current children's foster home license
application and children's foster home licensing transaction
record documents from the certifying agency.
Two of the three borrowed home files reviewed either did not include a copy of the
current license (3706) or did not include a copy of the current application for the
home.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(a) Submit a special investigation record to the department's
licensing authority within 5 working days in the manner
prescribed by the department.
One of the three special evaluation records reviewed indicated the special
investigation record (259) was not submitted to the department’s licensing authority
within the 5 working days as required by this rule. In this example the intake date
was identified as 12/28/2020 and the 259 was submitted 01/13/2021.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that he or she has a
right to have his or her written response included as an
attachment to the report required by subrule (5) of this rule.
Three of the three special evaluation records reviewed did not include
documentation the foster parents were informed in writing they could have a written
response included as an attachment to the completed report. The agency previously
included this language in a standard letter that was sent to the foster parents with
the report, but this language was missing from the special evaluations reviewed.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(4) If an emergency change in placement is necessary, then all
of the documentation required in subrules (2) and (3) of this rule
4

shall be in the child's record within 14 calendar days after the
change in placement.
One of the eight current foster child records reviewed indicated the foster child had
at least one change in placement and the documentation for the change in
placement could not be located. In this example it appeared this youth had 8
changes in placement where sufficient documentation of the changes could not be
found.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(2) An agency shall have documentation from the medical or
dental provider of all medical and dental care received by a
foster child.
Three of the eight current foster child records reviewed did not include medical
passports with the documentation of all medical or dental care received by the foster
child and/or medical passports that included signatures by the caregivers of the
foster child.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 4.22
Examples of some missing documentation from foster home files in the MISACWIS
information system included copies of current foster home licenses (3706 ) in four of the
eight foster home files reviewed. Examples of some missing information in three of the
eight foster child records were Parent Agency Treatment Plans and/or Parent Agency
Treatment Plans with signatures. This is a repeat noncompliance with the renewal
evaluation completed 05/08/2020.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
None required.
IV. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None required. There were no alerts as reported in the findings of the analyst.
5

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation
completed 05/08/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of the renewal
evaluation were R 400.12324 (4), R 400.12327 (5)(d), R 400.12418 (2)(b), ISEP 4.22,
DHHS Policy 722-06B, and FTM completions. The only areas identified as repeat
noncompliance as a part of this interim evaluation were R 400.12324 (4), and ISEP
4.22.
V. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
08/04/2021
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 16, 2021
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
